description: Alterations including installation of replacement entrance doors to Wandsworth High Street and installation of air intake/extract louvres to east and west facades. (linked to listed building consent 2020/1608).
site_name: Development Site Of Former Ram Brewery
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [3562: 10 00 01 P3; 12 00 01 P3; 12 0 01 P3; 12 01 01 P3; 12 SH 01 P3; 20 00 01 P2; 20 01 01 P2; 20 SH01 P2; 44 00 01 P2; 44 01 01 P2;  45 00 01 P2; 52 00 01 P3; 52 00 02 P2; 52 01 01 P2; 52 01 02 P2; 53 00 01 P2; 52 01 01 P2;  E401 D; P400 G; P400 1 D; P 401 E; P 401 1 D; P406 F; P407 E P010 M; P011 O; P030 I; P031 I; P032 I; P033 I; P040 L; P041 K; P042 L; P043 F; P044 G; P045 G;  Noise Outbreak Assessment (dated April 2020).  
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - Prior to the commencement of the use of the commercial unit as a bowling alley, the following mitigation measures outlined in the approved Noise Outbreak Assessment (dated April 2020) shall be fully implemented: 
- The installation of a mass heavy enclosure around the pin pits.  The perimeter flanking walls of the enclosure shall be independently lined with dense plasterboard;
- The separation of the bowling alleys from the main structure and the use of  anti-vibration pads.
- The use of atmospheric attenuators to address noise from mechanical plant.  The attenuators shall achieve a noise level 5 dB below the prevailing background LA90.  
The measures shall be maintained in perpetuity.  
Reason: To protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with DMPD (2016) policy DMS1c.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2019 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
